CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 1, 1955, page 7, reads: "Human Relations Group - Mayor David L. Lawrence announced the appointment of fifteen Pittsburghers last week as members of the Commission on Human Relations. This group will supplant the Civic Unity Council and Fair Employment Practices Committee. Sworn in by the Mayor in City Council Chambers Friday were James Jordon, Atty. T.Z. Korsak, Mrs. Louis J. Reizenstein, Dr. Howard C. Scharfe, Roland M. Sawyer, Dean N.R.H. Moor, the Rev. E.V. May, Mrs. Jonas Salk, Mrs. Thomas Parran, Frederick C. McKee, Emory Bacon, Anthony J. Federoff, John A. Feigel and Attorney J. Alfred Wilner. Absent from the group was the Rt. Rev. Msgr. A.J. Pauley. - Harris Photo."David L. Lawrence was Mayor of the City of Pittsburgh 1946-1959, Governor of Pennsylvania 1959-1963, and he died in 1966.
TitMainTitle: Pittsburgh Mayor David L. Lawrence announcing appointments for Commission on Human Relations, including James Jordon, Attorney T. Z. Korsak, Florence Reizenstein, Dr. Howard C. Scharfe, Roland M. Sawyer, Dean N. R. H. Moor, Rev. E. V. May, Mrs. Jonas Salk, Mrs. Thomas Parran, Frederick C. McKee, Emory Bacon, Anthony J. Federoff, John A. Feigel, Attorney J. Alfred Wilner, and police officer standing in background, Pittsburgh City Council Chambers, City County Building
